summary: This is a forensic report from the FBI's New York Field Office detailing the manual review of three Bureau of Prisons (BOP)-issued Samsung Galaxy S9 cell phones. The review was conducted to investigate staff failures and falsification of documents related to the suicide of Jeffrey Epstein. The phones were not seized as evidence but were manually reviewed on-site at the BOP and then returned to the users.

events.title: Epstein Suicide and Phone Seizure
events.description: Three BOP-issued Samsung Galaxy S9 phones were seized from staff for manual review following the suicide of Jeffrey Epstein, to investigate staff failure to perform proper rounds and falsification of documents.

events.title: Manual Phone Review
events.description: Forensic manual review of three BOP staff cell phones was conducted on-site at the BOP. Only one message of potential relevancy was found on one phone; the others had no relevant items. Phones were returned to users.

events.title: Forensic Report Review
events.description: An FBI Special Agent (SA) performed the technical review and approved the forensic examination report.

locations: Bureau of Prisons (BOP) facility (unspecified location where phones were reviewed)
keyFacts: The forensic examination was initiated to investigate BOP staff failure to perform proper rounds and falsification of documents related to Jeffrey Epstein's suicide.
Three specific BOP-issued Samsung Galaxy S9 phones (property numbers 207677, 207672, 207675) were manually reviewed on 2019-08-22.
The phones were not seized as evidence; they were reviewed on-site at the BOP and then returned to the staff users.
Only one of the three phones contained a single message of potential relevancy, which was captured via screenshot.
The forensic report was produced and approved in February 2020, confirming the examination was forensically sound and the conclusions were reasonable.
